AnalyserNodeMaxDecibels.summary: The maxDecibels property of the interface is a double value representing the maximum power value in the scaling range for the FFT analysis data, for conversion to unsigned byte values â€” basically, this specifies the maximum value for the range of results when using getByteFrequencyData().
AnalyserNodeMaxDecibels.value: A double, representing the maximum decibel value for scaling the FFT analysis data, where 0 dB is the loudest possible sound, -10 dB is a 10th of that, etc. The default value is -30 dB.When getting data from getByteFrequencyData(), any frequencies with an amplitude of maxDecibels or higher will be returned as 255.
